events.name: Record-breaking global temperatures in September 2023
events.wd_description: September 2023 recorded the highest global temperatures ever at 1.75°C, driven by the El Niño weather event and ongoing emissions of warming gases, surpassing previous records significantly.
events.description: September 2023 recorded the highest global temperatures ever at 1.75°C, driven by the El Niño weather event and ongoing emissions of warming gases, surpassing previous records significantly.

events.name: El Niño weather event
events.wd_description: The El Niño weather event contributed to the significant rise in global temperatures in September 2023, compounding the effects of ongoing emissions.
events.description: The El Niño weather event contributed to the significant rise in global temperatures in September 2023, compounding the effects of ongoing emissions.

events.name: Global temperature increase
events.wd_description: September 2023 saw a 1.75°C global temperature, 0.5°C higher than the previous record, and 0.93°C above the average temperature for September between 1991 and 2020.
events.description: September 2023 saw a 1.75°C global temperature, 0.5°C higher than the previous record, and 0.93°C above the average temperature for September between 1991 and 2020.

events.name: Political implications for COP28
events.wd_description: The unprecedented rise in global temperatures places new pressure on politicians as they prepare for the COP28 climate summit in November 2023.
events.description: The unprecedented rise in global temperatures places new pressure on politicians as they prepare for the COP28 climate summit in November 2023.

events.name: Israeli strike on ambulance in Gaza
events.wd_label: Israeli strike on ambulance in Gaza
events.wd_description: An Israeli strike on an ambulance outside Gaza City's largest hospital killed at least 15 people, with Israel claiming the ambulance was used by Hamas operatives.
events.description: An Israeli strike on an ambulance outside Gaza City's largest hospital killed at least 15 people, with Israel claiming the ambulance was used by Hamas operatives.

events.name: Ambulance strike
events.wd_description: The Palestinian Red Crescent confirmed that an Israeli strike on an ambulance outside Al-Shifa Hospital killed at least 15 people.
events.description: The Palestinian Red Crescent confirmed that an Israeli strike on an ambulance outside Al-Shifa Hospital killed at least 15 people.

events.name: Convoy attack
events.wd_description: The Hamas government reported that the convoy of ambulances transporting the wounded was struck twice, once 1km away and again outside the hospital gate.
events.description: The Hamas government reported that the convoy of ambulances transporting the wounded was struck twice, once 1km away and again outside the hospital gate.

events.name: Wounded evacuation
events.wd_description: Only 17 Palestinians wounded were evacuated to an Egyptian hospital, instead of the originally planned 28, according to the Ministry of Health in Egypt.
events.description: Only 17 Palestinians wounded were evacuated to an Egyptian hospital, instead of the originally planned 28, according to the Ministry of Health in Egypt.

events.name: Diplomatic tensions between India and Canada
events.wd_label: Diplomatic tensions between India and Canada
events.wd_description: India has directed Canada to withdraw close to 40 diplomatic staff and confirmed those who stayed past October 10 would lose their diplomatic immunity.
events.description: India has directed Canada to withdraw close to 40 diplomatic staff and confirmed those who stayed past October 10 would lose their diplomatic immunity.

events.name: Diplomatic staff withdrawal
events.wd_description: India has instructed Canada to withdraw nearly 40 diplomatic staff from the country, with a deadline of October 10 for maintaining diplomatic immunity.
events.description: India has instructed Canada to withdraw nearly 40 diplomatic staff from the country, with a deadline of October 10 for maintaining diplomatic immunity.

events.name: Allegations of involvement in killing
events.wd_description: Canada accused India of involvement in the killing of Sikh separatist leader Hardeep Singh Nijjar on Canadian soil, an allegation denied by India.
events.description: Canada accused India of involvement in the killing of Sikh separatist leader Hardeep Singh Nijjar on Canadian soil, an allegation denied by India.

events.name: Trudeau's response
events.wd_description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau stated that he does not plan to escalate the rift with India and emphasized ongoing responsible and constructive engagement.
events.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau stated that he does not plan to escalate the rift with India and emphasized ongoing responsible and constructive engagement.

events.name: Senator Manchin's Call for Strict EV Tax Credit Standards
events.wd_label: Senator Manchin's Call for Strict EV Tax Credit Standards
events.wd_description: Democratic Senator Joe Manchin urged the U.S. Treasury to adopt the strictest possible standards to prevent Chinese-produced minerals or battery companies from receiving electric vehicle tax credits.
events.description: Democratic Senator Joe Manchin urged the U.S. Treasury to adopt the strictest possible standards to prevent Chinese-produced minerals or battery companies from receiving electric vehicle tax credits.

events.name: Manchin's Letter to Treasury
events.wd_description: Senator Joe Manchin raised concerns in a letter to Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen about Chinese battery companies seeking to take advantage of U.S. EV tax credits.
events.description: Senator Joe Manchin raised concerns in a letter to Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen about Chinese battery companies seeking to take advantage of U.S. EV tax credits.

events.name: Inflation Reduction Act Provisions
events.wd_description: The Inflation Reduction Act bars $7,500 in consumer EV tax credits if any battery components are manufactured or assembled by a "foreign entity of concern."
events.description: The Inflation Reduction Act bars $7,500 in consumer EV tax credits if any battery components are manufactured or assembled by a "foreign entity of concern."

events.name: t: Definition of Foreign Entity of Concern
events.wd_label: t: Definition of Foreign Entity of Concern
events.wd_description: The auto industry awaits detailed guidance on what constitutes a "foreign entity of concern" as they plan battery production investments.
events.description: The auto industry awaits detailed guidance on what constitutes a "foreign entity of concern" as they plan battery production investments.

events.name: t: Impact on Battery Supply Chains
events.wd_label: t: Impact on Battery Supply Chains
events.wd_description: The rules aim to reduce U.S. dependency on Chinese battery supply chains, which currently dominate global cathode, anode, and lithium-ion battery cell production.
events.description: The rules aim to reduce U.S. dependency on Chinese battery supply chains, which currently dominate global cathode, anode, and lithium-ion battery cell production.

events.name: Treasury's Response
events.wd_description: A Treasury spokesperson stated they will assess and respond to national security concerns associated with international and domestic supply chains as the clean energy market evolves.
events.description: A Treasury spokesperson stated they will assess and respond to national security concerns associated with international and domestic supply chains as the clean energy market evolves.

events.name: Ford's Licensing Deal Concerns
events.wd_description: Concerns have been raised about Ford's deal to license Chinese battery manufacturer CATL's technology for use in U.S. battery plants and its eligibility for tax credits.
events.description: Concerns have been raised about Ford's deal to license Chinese battery manufacturer CATL's technology for use in U.S. battery plants and its eligibility for tax credits.

events.name: t: Ford's Michigan Plant Hold
events.wd_description: Ford has put its planned $3.5 billion Michigan battery plant on hold, awaiting final guidance from the Treasury on tax credit eligibility.
events.description: Ford has put its planned $3.5 billion Michigan battery plant on hold, awaiting final guidance from the Treasury on tax credit eligibility.

events.name: t: Lawmaker Concerns
events.wd_description: U.S. lawmakers have expressed concerns about the arrangement between Ford and CATL meeting Treasury standards for tax credits.
events.description: U.S. lawmakers have expressed concerns about the arrangement between Ford and CATL meeting Treasury standards for tax credits.
